alert.note: Alert for Dooly (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 07 at 12:45PM EDT until April 07 at 8:45PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Peachtree City GA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Georgia... Turkey Creek at Byromville affecting Dooly County. For the Flint River Basin...including Turkey Creek at Byromville... Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Turkey Creek at Byromville. * WHEN...From this afternoon to this evening. * IMPACTS...At 10 feet, Flood stage is reached. Minor flooding of woodlands occurs upstream and downstream from the stream gage on Georgia Highway 90. Portions of creek access roads and low lying areas will begin to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:45 AM EDT Thursday the stage was 9.9 feet and rising. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage this afternoon and continue falling to 6.7 feet tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 10 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 10.2 feet on 04/21/2020. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
